intro: Streblosa palawanensis var. elmeri, commonly known as the Palawan streblosa, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
